titleStmt.title: George Wolford and Worthington Frothingham to Unknown
CWG2609

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
The undersigned have this day associated themselves, as partners, under the firm name of
WOLFORD & FROTHINGHAM,
in the Practice of Law, in all its branches, in the State and United States Courts. They will also give prompt attention to Collections, Investing Moneys, Negociating Loans, Conveyancing, &c., &c.; and, having Correspondents at Boston, Providence, Philadelphia, Cleveland, Detroit, Milwaukee, Iowa City and St. Paul, they will give their attention to such Legal Business as may arise in those localities, and which may be intrusted to their care.
N. B. -- Office No. 69 State Street, where hereafter Mr. Wolford will have his Chambers for the transaction of his official business as Albany County Judge.
